articles.author: Brett Konen
articles.text:
Compared to most other cocktails and mocktails, punches are easy-peasy – combine all ingredients, stir, chill, and serve. In lieu of extensive preparation, the best punches are simply made by layering complementary flavors, and terpene-laden cannabis adds one more element of both flavor and effect, augmenting the overall experience of classic fall punch drinks.
The following autumnal drink recipes are adapted to accommodate the addition of cannabis tinctures. While any infused tincture you have on hand will do, we’ve recommended a few specific strains whose terpenes amplify each elixir. If you don’t have any tinctures handy, you can make your own, or check the menus of your favorite local dispensaries to find a place where you can pick one up.

Mix up a batch of one of the following, pop the pitcher in your fridge, and enjoy an extra-chill punch at your leisure. Cheers to fall!
Sparkling Sativa-Pear Punch

This pretty pink punch is ideal for the last few semi-sunny fall afternoons on the patio or porch. Whether you’re expecting company or cozied up on your own, keep plenty on hand so you’re ready whenever autumn calls for something to sip.

2 parts pear nectar or pear juice
2 parts Prosecco (make this a non-alcoholic punch with sparkling cider or lemon-lime soda)
1 part cranberry juice
10 mg-worth of cannabis tincture (suggested strains: sweet Candy Jack, tart Vortex, or floral Alice in Wonderland)
Garnish: pear slice and/or freshly grated nutmeg

Adapted from Sparking Pear-Prosecco Punch by Delish.
Canna-Pome-Grapefruit Punch

This fruity pomegranate-grapefruit concoction marries your cannabis tincture with bright citrus notes and deep dark pomegranate colors and characteristics. It’s bold, beautiful, and guaranteed to put a smile on your face.

2 parts pomegranate juice
1 part grapefruit vodka (try Deep Eddy, Smirnoff, or Absolut – or omit the alcohol by subbing in soda water)
1 part fresh-squeezed grapefruit juice
10 mg-worth of cannabis tincture (suggested strains: fruit-punchy Dream Berry, grapefruit-orangey Citrix, or the descriptively-named Grapefruit)
Garnish: pomegranate seeds or a grapefruit wheel

Adapted from Pomegranate Grapefruit Punch by A Simple Pantry.
Autumn Apple Indica Punch

This non-alcoholic apple punch is bona-fide fall in a glass: at once crisp, cool, juicy, and refreshing, it’s ratcheted up a notch by the addition of an indica-infused tincture. What better way to melt seasonal stress away?

3 parts apple cider
2 parts cranberry juice
1 part ginger beer
10 mg-worth of cannabis tincture (suggested strains: apple-vanilla Butter OG, honeyed Cream Caramel, or rich, sweet Love Potion #9)
Squeeze of fresh lime juice
Garnish: fresh cranberries and a cinnamon stick

Adapted from Apple Orchard Punch by Allrecipes.
Note: Always imbibe both cannabis and alcohol responsibly, and never drive after consuming either. When in doubt on the potency of your tincture, start with a small amount and work up – you can always add more, but you can’t add less.
articles.title: Try These Cannabis-Infused Fall Punch Recipes That Use Fruity Strains

articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
This week the Leafly Explorer gained four new varieties recommended to us by you fine folks (keep 'em coming!). Alaskan Ice from Green House Seeds is a finnicky grow, but this sativa's intense euphoria is well worth the challenge in the garden. Our new indica strain from the southern Chinese province of Yunnan is a go-to medicine for aches, pains, and bad moods. Dream Berry, another elite strain from Apothecary Genetics, puts an indica spin on fan-favorite Blue Dream by adding Blueberry to the mix. Last but not least, we added two high-CBD strains, Harle-Tsu and Zen, which have worked wonders for patients treating pain, inflammation, and digestive issues.
Are these strains old news to you? If the experience was unforgettable, be sure to leave a review for the ones you've tried!
   1. Alaskan Ice
Characteristics of Alaskan Ice:

70% sativa
Cross between White Widow and Haze
Breeder: Green House Seeds
Sour, spicy aroma
Euphoric with intoxicating potency
Indoor flowering time of 9 weeks

   2. China Yunnan
Characteristics of China Yunnan:

80% indica
Unknown indica crossed with a South Asian sativa
Breeder: ACE Seeds
Sweet, woody aroma
Brings happy effects, sensory elevation, and full-body calm
Good for treating pain, sleeplessness, and anxiety
Indoor flowering time of 8 to 9 weeks

   3. Dream Berry
Characteristics of Dream Berry:

Mostly indica strain
Cross between Blue Dream and Blackberry
Breeder: Apothecary Genetics
Sweet, berry aroma
Delivers calming indica qualities
Indoor flowering time of 6 to 7 weeks

   4. Harle-Tsu
Characteristics of Harle-Tsu:

Hybrid strain
Cross between Harlequin and Sour Tsunami
Breeder: Southern Humbolt Seed Collective
Has high-CBD content and little to no psychoactivity
Good for pain and inflammation relief
Indoor flowering time of 8 weeks

   5. Zen
Characteristics of Zen:

Indica-dominant hybrid
Cross between Mexican Sativa, Afghani, and Lavender
Breeder: CBD Seeds
Balances THC and CBD contents
Earthy, berry aroma
Good for treating appetite loss, nausea, anorexia, Crohn's disease, and anxiety
Indoor flowering time of 10 weeks
articles.title: New Strains Alert: Alaskan Ice, China Yunnan, Dream Berry, Harle-Tsu, and Zen

description: Dream Berry is a sweet, fruity cross between Blue Dream and Blackberry. Its calming indica qualities prevail over its sativa genetics. The breeders at Apothecary Genetics recommend a short 6 to 7 week flowering time for indoor gardens, or the end of September for outdoor cultivators.
descriptionPlain: Dream Berry is a sweet, fruity cross between Blue Dream and Blackberry. Its calming indica qualities prevail over its sativa genetics. The breeders at Apothecary Genetics recommend a short 6 to 7 week flowering time for indoor gardens, or the end of September for outdoor cultivators.

highlightedReviews.text: By far the best I've had in a while. I sometimes get anxious after smoking high stavia strains and found the indica strains work best for my anxiety and stress. I like that Dream Berry relaxes me but I can still function around the house in a nice, euphoric calm without my brain stressing about stupid stuff. It tastes great too. I'll buy this one again for sure but will continue to try other indica stains as I'm only starting this journey. I'll review others soon ...
Low key. Chilled out. Sweet and tangy.

name: Dream Berry
